Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: She then told me that I felt like a sheep and she imitated the noises of one.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Aaliyah Wilburn moved to Vermont two years ago and has faced more hair discrimination here than ever before.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: senior at North Country Union High School
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Aaliyah Wilburn moved to Vermont two years ago and has faced more hair discrimination here than ever before.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: A senior at North Country Union High School in Newport, Wilburn, 17, recalls being in line for the bathroom when the girl in front turned around and reached for her hair.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: senior at North Country Union High School
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: A senior at North Country Union High School in Newport, Wilburn, 17, recalls being in line for the bathroom when the girl in front turned around and reached for her hair.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Despite telling her not to touch it, Wilburn said the girl 'grabbed' her hair.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: senior at North Country Union High School
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Despite telling her not to touch it, Wilburn said the girl 'grabbed' her hair.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: She then told me that I felt like a sheep and she imitated the noises of one.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: senior at North Country Union High School
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: She then told me that I felt like a sheep and she imitated the noises of one.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Once, when she was wearing a head covering because she was in the midst of braiding her hair, Wilburn said a student pulled it off and ran away in the school hall.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: senior at North Country Union High School
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Once, when she was wearing a head covering because she was in the midst of braiding her hair, Wilburn said a student pulled it off and ran away in the school hall.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: When she wore a headwrap another time, students said she looked like Marge Simpson and that she looked too African for their comfort.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: senior at North Country Union High School
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: When she wore a headwrap another time, students said she looked like Marge Simpson and that she looked too African for their comfort.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Later in the day, someone took it off me.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: senior at North Country Union High School
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Later in the day, someone took it off me.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Wilburn and the student anti-racism network support a bill, which the Vermont House passed in a landslide vote on Wednesday, that would prohibit racial discrimination by hair types, textures and styles.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: senior at North Country Union High School
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Wilburn and the student anti-racism network support a bill, which the Vermont House passed in a landslide vote on Wednesday, that would prohibit racial discrimination by hair types, textures and styles.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: It’s important for Wilburn because it could help limit the experiences she has faced in school.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: senior at North Country Union High School
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: It’s important for Wilburn because it could help limit the experiences she has faced in school.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: I wouldn’t be scared of going out with a bonnet or a head wrap if this bill was in place at the time of these incidents.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: senior at North Country Union High School
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: I wouldn’t be scared of going out with a bonnet or a head wrap if this bill was in place at the time of these incidents.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Addie Lentzner, executive director of the student anti-racism network, said she has seen hair discrimination in schools — not just in policies and norms but also in the form of microaggressions and racial bias.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: executive director of the student anti-racism network
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Addie Lentzner, executive director of the student anti-racism network, said she has seen hair discrimination in schools — not just in policies and norms but also in the form of microaggressions and racial bias.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: I think it’s a huge problem in our schools and this bill would help address it.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: executive director of the student anti-racism network
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: I think it’s a huge problem in our schools and this bill would help address it.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Modeled after language promoted as the CROWN Act and already enacted in 23 other states, including New York and Maine, the bill aims to prevent 'an erasure and minimization of the experiences of marginalized people,' particularly Black and brown people, Rep. Saudia LaMont, D-Morristown, said during a preliminary vote on the bill Tuesday.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Modeled after language promoted as the CROWN Act and already enacted in 23 other states, including New York and Maine, the bill aims to prevent 'an erasure and minimization of the experiences of marginalized people,' particularly Black and brown people, Rep. Saudia LaMont, D-Morristown, said during a preliminary vote on the bill Tuesday.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: She cited a 2023 study that found 66% of Black girls in predominantly white schools and 44% of Black girls in all schools report experiencing hair discrimination, and that the experiences typically happen before they are 10.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: She cited a 2023 study that found 66% of Black girls in predominantly white schools and 44% of Black girls in all schools report experiencing hair discrimination, and that the experiences typically happen before they are 10.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: For her daughter, she said, it first occurred in pre-school.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: For her daughter, she said, it first occurred in pre-school.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: While picking up her daughter one afternoon she said she was dismayed to find her wearing a stop sign on her chest that read, 'Please ask to touch my hair.'
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: While picking up her daughter one afternoon she said she was dismayed to find her wearing a stop sign on her chest that read, 'Please ask to touch my hair.'

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: A teacher explained that her daughter was reacting to several instances of students touching and petting her hair without her consent, LaMont continued.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: A teacher explained that her daughter was reacting to several instances of students touching and petting her hair without her consent, LaMont continued.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: So it was in fact my 4-year-old’s idea to make a sign as a signal to her peers to stop violating her body and personal space.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: So it was in fact my 4-year-old’s idea to make a sign as a signal to her peers to stop violating her body and personal space.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: In another incident, her daughter’s dance teacher asked to have her recently installed braids taken out so the child’s hair could be put up in a bun to look like the majority of the other white kids in the class.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: In another incident, her daughter’s dance teacher asked to have her recently installed braids taken out so the child’s hair could be put up in a bun to look like the majority of the other white kids in the class.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: LaMont outlined to her House colleagues on Tuesday the ways in which caring for Black hair is a process.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: LaMont outlined to her House colleagues on Tuesday the ways in which caring for Black hair is a process.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: It can take a day to wash, dry and detangle and protective styling, such as box braids or twists, can involve 8 to 22 hours of work.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: It can take a day to wash, dry and detangle and protective styling, such as box braids or twists, can involve 8 to 22 hours of work.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: The bill is important, she said then, because 'hair type, textures, styles, protective hairstyles' are 'a symbol of one’s identity and ability to show up authentically,' which includes 'the freedom to take pride in one’s appearance in ways people choose that feels in alignment with the traits that are associated with their race (and) improves confidence, self esteem, dignity and respect.'
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The bill is important, she said then, because 'hair type, textures, styles, protective hairstyles' are 'a symbol of one’s identity and ability to show up authentically,' which includes 'the freedom to take pride in one’s appearance in ways people choose that feels in alignment with the traits that are associated with their race (and) improves confidence, self esteem, dignity and respect.'

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Black women’s hair is more likely to be perceived as unprofessional, she said, citing surveys.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Black women’s hair is more likely to be perceived as unprofessional, she said, citing surveys.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Many of them feel they must wear their hair straight in a job interview and report being sent home or denied a job because of their hair.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Many of them feel they must wear their hair straight in a job interview and report being sent home or denied a job because of their hair.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: The same kind of assumptions are used to prevent students with certain hairstyles from engaging in sports and other activities, she added.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The same kind of assumptions are used to prevent students with certain hairstyles from engaging in sports and other activities, she added.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Hair and head coverings do not determine behavior, capacity or competency and people should not be penalized, discriminated against or treated as such.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Hair and head coverings do not determine behavior, capacity or competency and people should not be penalized, discriminated against or treated as such.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Hair discrimination is degrading, disrespectful and invades people’s privacy in deep ways, said one of the bill’s primary sponsors, Rep. Kevin 'Coach' Christie, D-Hartford.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Hair discrimination is degrading, disrespectful and invades people’s privacy in deep ways, said one of the bill’s primary sponsors, Rep. Kevin 'Coach' Christie, D-Hartford.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: He pointed to incidents of it nationwide that have challenged athletes, students and teachers.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: He pointed to incidents of it nationwide that have challenged athletes, students and teachers.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: These include students being punished for wearing braids in Massachusetts, a basketball player who referees initially barred from a game because of beads in her hair in New Jersey and a high school in Texas disciplining a student who refused to change his locs.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: These include students being punished for wearing braids in Massachusetts, a basketball player who referees initially barred from a game because of beads in her hair in New Jersey and a high school in Texas disciplining a student who refused to change his locs.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Prominent during the Civil Rights movement, the fight for the right of Black people to wear their hair their way continues across the country.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Prominent during the Civil Rights movement, the fight for the right of Black people to wear their hair their way continues across the country.
